name: Proxima Centauri b
description: Closest known exoplanet to Earth, potentially within its star's habitable zone.

name: TRAPPIST-1e
description: Potentially habitable Earth-sized exoplanet in a seven-planet system.

name: Kepler-22b
description: Super-Earth in the habitable zone of a Sun-like star.

name: Gliese 581g
description: Candidate for habitability, orbiting a red dwarf star.

name: HD 209458 b (Osiris)
description: First exoplanet observed transiting its star.

name: Kepler-452b
description: Nicknamed 'Earth 2.0,' it orbits a Sun-like star in the habitable zone.

name: LHS 1140 b
description: Rocky super-Earth in the habitable zone of a red dwarf star.

name: 55 Cancri e
description: Lava world orbiting very close to its host star.

name: HR 8799 c
description: Directly imaged gas giant planet.

name: Kepler-16b
description: Circumbinary planet orbiting two stars.

name: Kepler-186f
description: First Earth-sized exoplanet discovered in a habitable zone.

name: TOI-700 d
description: Potentially habitable planet discovered by TESS.

name: K2-18b
description: Sub-Neptune with water vapor detected in its atmosphere.

name: PSR B1257+12 c
description: Pulsar planet discovered orbiting a neutron star.

name: GJ 1214 b
description: Mini-Neptune with a thick atmosphere.

name: Kepler-10b
description: A rocky exoplanet with an extremely short orbital period of less than a day.

name: Kepler-20e
description: One of the smallest confirmed exoplanets, slightly smaller than Venus.

name: Gliese 667 Cc
description: Located in the habitable zone of a red dwarf, it is a candidate for potential habitability.

name: WASP-18b
description: A massive hot Jupiter with an extremely short orbital period.

name: Kepler-11f
description: Part of a six-planet system, it is one of the most tightly packed planetary systems discovered.

name: GJ 504 b
description: A directly imaged gas giant with a striking pink hue.

name: Kepler-444f
description: One of five Earth-sized planets in an ancient planetary system over 11 billion years old.

name: HAT-P-7b
description: A hot Jupiter exhibiting extreme atmospheric dynamics, including supersonic winds.

name: Kepler-438b
description: An Earth-like planet located in the habitable zone of a red dwarf.

name: HD 189733 b
description: Known for its deep blue color caused by atmospheric silicate particles.

name: Kepler-90i
description: Part of the eight-planet Kepler-90 system, it is the smallest in the system.

name: 51 Pegasi b
description: The first exoplanet discovered around a Sun-like star, nicknamed Bellerophon.

name: TOI-178c
description: Part of a fascinating resonant chain of planets orbiting TOI-178.

name: Wolf 1061c
description: Located in the habitable zone of a red dwarf, a candidate for further study.

name: Kepler-1652b
description: An Earth-like planet with high potential for habitability.

name: HD 209458 b
description: A well-studied exoplanet known for its evaporating atmosphere.

name: Kepler-37b
description: The smallest known exoplanet, about the size of the Moon.

name: CoRoT-7b
description: A rocky planet with extreme volcanic activity due to its proximity to its star.

name: Tau Ceti f
description: A potentially habitable exoplanet orbiting a nearby star.

name: Kepler-13Ab
description: A hot Jupiter with a tilted orbit causing extreme weather variations.

name: Kepler-78b
description: A lava world with a very short orbital period of 8.5 hours.

name: Kepler-90h
description: The outermost planet of the eight-planet Kepler-90 system.

name: GJ 357 d
description: A super-Earth in the habitable zone of its host star.

name: LTT 1445 A b
description: An Earth-sized planet orbiting one star in a triple-star system.

name: Kepler-51b

name: KELT-9b
description: The hottest known exoplanet, with surface temperatures exceeding 4,600 K.

name: HD 40307 g
description: A super-Earth in the habitable zone of its host star.

name: Kepler-36b
description: A rocky planet in a system with a closely orbiting Neptune-like planet.

name: Kepler-421b
description: An exoplanet with an exceptionally long orbital period of 704 days.

name: HD 189733 b
description: A hot Jupiter with a cobalt-blue color caused by atmospheric particles.

name: WASP-107b
description: A super-puff planet with a density similar to cotton candy.

name: TOI-849b

name: HD 209458 b
description: One of the first exoplanets observed with an evaporating atmosphere.

name: Kepler-1649c
description: An Earth-sized planet located in the habitable zone of its star.

description: A cold super-Earth discovered via gravitational microlensing.

description: An ancient exoplanet orbiting one of the oldest stars in the galaxy.

name: Kepler-442b

description: A super-Earth in the habitable zone of a Sun-like star.

description: A rocky planet with a very short orbital period.

description: A circumbinary planet orbiting two stars.

name: GJ 806b
description: GJ 806b is a close-orbiting exoplanet around the red dwarf GJ 806. It has a short orbital period of about 0.93 days and a surface temperature of around 940 K. It is 1.33 times the radius of Earth and has a mass of 1.90 Earth masses. The planet is detected via radial velocity and transit methods.

name: Barnard's Star b
description: A super-Earth orbiting Barnard's Star, the second closest stellar system to the Sun.

name: Wolf 1061c
description: A potentially habitable super-Earth located within the habitable zone of its red dwarf star.
